results.title: Associations Between the Use of Metformin and Behavioral and Psychological Symptoms in Patients with Alzheimer s Disease, and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus - a Register-Based Study.
results.text_hl: Although, more knowledge is needed before assigning @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ a role in treating @<m>DISEASE_Psychological_Trauma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067073 @@@BPSD@@@.

results.title: Metformin improves anxiety-like behaviors through AMPK-dependent regulation of autophagy following transient forebrain ischemia.
results.text_hl: Our results recommended that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy could improve @<m>DISEASE_Psychological_Trauma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067073 @@@psychological disorders@@@ and @DISEASE_Movement_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D009069 @@@movement disability@@@ following @DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@I/R@@@ and profound understanding of @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_78975 @@@AMPK@@@-dependent autophagy would enhance its development as a promising target for intracellular pathway.

citations.NLM: Sarkaki A, Farbood Y, Badavi M, Khalaj L, Khodagholi F, Ashabi G. Metformin improves anxiety-like behaviors through AMPK-dependent regulation of autophagy following transient forebrain ischemia. Metab Brain Dis. 2015 Oct;30(5):1139-50. PMID: 25936719
